attributes.action: To challenge location of Link road Roundabout
attributes.additional_details: Shepshed is a town of 15000 people living in the shadow of Loughborough but we are also a victim of location being in the triangle of Derby, Leicester and Nottingham so have become a commuter town in as much we are having a great deal of new build in town of close to 1500 extra houses on top of that we have the Garendon development which is 3000 houses. The town accepts this all though not well this comes down to the location of a link road and roundabout 300 metres up the road the watermill can be open to the public where it has been approved now it cannot and Shepshed Loses again .
attributes.background: Shepshed is a town that has a proud heritage and one of those aspects in is the water mill, a town where history of our industries are respected and we have various elements that form this

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local roads are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
